articles.headline: Once Concerned, China Is Quiet About Trans-Pacific Trade Deal
articles.snippet: Some leading Chinese trade policy figures now say the American-led pact could even make it easier for Beijing to pursue its own regional agreements.
articles.abstract: Some leading Chinese trade policy figures now say the American-led pact could even make it easier for Beijing to pursue its own regional agreements.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As Congress debates the direction of economic policy in the Pacific, the main country worried about an American-led trade deal has gone nearly silent: China.

articles.headline: Twitter Earnings, Released Early, Disappoint Investors
articles.snippet: Investors have been eager to see results from recent changes Twitter has made to help newcomers better understand how to use its service.
articles.abstract: Investors have been eager to see results from recent changes Twitter has made to help newcomers better understand how to use its service.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — As Twitter has struggled to attract new users, the one bright spot has been its ability to wring more and more advertising dollars from marketing messages shown to the people on its service.

articles.headline: Income Inequality Is Costing the U.S. on Social Issues
articles.snippet: When the economic underpinning of full employment at a decent wage gave in, America’s safety net proved too weak to hold society together.
articles.abstract: When the economic underpinning of full employment at a decent wage gave in, America’s safety net proved too weak to hold society together.
articles.lead_paragraph: Thirty-five years ago, the United States ranked 13th among the 34 industrialized nations that are today in the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in terms of life expectancy for newborn girls. These days, it ranks 29th.

articles.headline: As Celiac and Gluten Sensitivities Gain Prominence, Drug Companies Race to Find Treatments
articles.snippet: It’s estimated that about three million Americans have celiac disease. And even though a gluten-free diet can help alleviate symptoms, it’s not a cure-all.
articles.abstract: It’s estimated that about three million Americans have celiac disease. And even though a gluten-free diet can help alleviate symptoms, it’s not a cure-all.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like many people with a sensitivity to gluten, Kristen Sweet avoids the protein in wheat that can make her sick. But when she eats at a friend’s house or a restaurant, she cannot be certain that the food is absolutely gluten-free.

articles.headline: Nepal’s Cultural Heritage Becomes Its Scrap as Human Crisis Takes Priority After Earthquake
articles.snippet: In many places, the detritus of centuries-old temples and palaces has been left unguarded, diminishing chances to eventually rebuild one of the world’s largest clusters of cultural heritage sites.
articles.abstract: In many places, the detritus of centuries-old temples and palaces has been left unguarded, diminishing chances to eventually rebuild one of the world’s largest clusters of cultural heritage sites.
articles.lead_paragraph: KATMANDU, Nepal — On Katmandu’s Basantapur Durbar Square on Tuesday, a heavy wooden beam was slipping down what was left of the Maju Dega Temple.
articles.byline: By Ellen Barry and Nida Najar

articles.headline: Baltimore Riots Are Another Scar on a City Long Battered by Neglect
articles.snippet: The riots in blighted neighborhoods on both sides of town were a heavy blow for a long-suffering city that had been showing signs of a comeback.
articles.abstract: The riots in blighted neighborhoods on both sides of town were a heavy blow for a long-suffering city that had been showing signs of a comeback.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — The Rev. Donte L. Hickman Sr. heard about the trouble brewing on this city’s west side on Monday afternoon and instantly took to Twitter to rally his East Baltimore troops.

articles.headline: Jean Nidetch, a Founder of Weight Watchers, Dies at 91
articles.snippet: A 214-pound Queens housewife struggled with a lifelong addiction to food until she shed 72 pounds and became the public face of the worldwide weight-control empire.
articles.abstract: A 214-pound Queens housewife struggled with a lifelong addiction to food until she shed 72 pounds and became the public face of the worldwide weight-control empire.
articles.lead_paragraph: She never ate dessert in public. But at night, by the dim light of the refrigerator, she gorged on goodies. Then one day in 1961, Jean Nidetch, a 214-pound Queens housewife with a 44-inch waist and an addiction to cookies by the box, ran into a neighbor at the supermarket.

articles.headline: Taliban Gains Pull U.S. Units Back Into Fight in Afghanistan
articles.snippet: Interviews with U.S. and Western officials in Kabul and Washington offer a picture of a more forceful range of military operations against the Taliban in recent months.
articles.abstract: Interviews with U.S. and Western officials in Kabul and Washington offer a picture of a more forceful range of military operations against the Taliban in recent months.
articles.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — Months after President Obama formally declared that the United States’ long war against the Taliban was over in Afghanistan, the American military is regularly conducting airstrikes against low-level insurgent forces and sending Special Operations troops directly into harm’s way under the guise of “training and advising.”
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Joseph Goldstein
